query: Picture 1: /home/z00533370/projects/datasets/LMUData/images/MMBench/453.jpg Hint: Read the text. Volcanic eruptions are classified by their appearance and their behavior. During a Hawaiian eruption, for example, lava is ejected from the volcano in a column. These jets can last for several hours or for days. The lava that flows from this type of eruption can often travel for miles before cooling and hardening. A Strombolian eruption, on the other hand, occurs when lava erupts from the volcano in short-lived bursts that result in scattered sprays of lava. These bursts often resemble bright, exploding fireworks. Question: Which term matches the picture? Options: A. Hawaiian eruption B. Strombolian eruption Please select the correct answer from the options above.
